title: "It's not my job to help your lane"
body:
It isn't to help me, but the junglers job isn't to fucking afk farm and hope your solo lanes carry you. either snowball mid, counter jungle, or go bot or DON'T JUNGLE. Thank you.

PS: IM A JUNGLE MAIN AND I HATE WHEN I AUTOFILL AND GET A BAD JUNGLER

replies.body: It isn't the JG's job to win your lane for you though. Like if you haven't been ganked and you just lose to the enemy laner because they play better you shouldn't flame JG
Are you fucking blind i said it isnt the junglers job to gank my lane idiot im a jungle main but if i can't gank i at least counter jungle instead of just afk farming and not gaining any lead.
Maybe the reason nobody wants to help you is because you have such a shitty attitude.
Please stop making sjws look good.

So many fucking times when I jg I get that stupid top laner that is 0-3-0 with 0 ganks from the enemy jg and they're flaming me. Like, no. You're just a fucking idiot and keep trying to 1v1 your enemy when he is clearly better. I'm not wasting my time ganking you. Don't be shit and you'll get a gank. Probably the biggest reason I've stopped jungling. Two lanes both die before I hit level 3 and start spam pinging "assist me".
Honestly the junglers job is to win their lane, just like everyone else. Sometimes they can't gank or counterjungle, and all you can really do at that point is outfarm/countergank.

It is hard. It takes experience to get a feel for what you can and can´t safely take. That autofill afk farming jungler is better doing that than dying trying to counterjungle or gank. Frustrating as that might be.

The jungler's job isn't to gank your lane. The jungler's primary job is to make use of the extra income from the jungle "lane." If an opportunity presents itself (wave in position, summoners down, stars aligned), then he might gank for you. That's the hard part. You actually have to work with your jungler to get what you want.

> [{quoted}](name=Blue Collar Bear,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=n9doWgAO,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2017-03-19T13:10:24.885+0000)
>
> The jungler's job isn't to gank your lane. The jungler's primary job is to make use of the extra income from the jungle "lane." If an opportunity presents itself (wave in position, summoners down, stars aligned), then he might gank for you. That's the hard part. You actually have to work with your jungler to get what you want.

Shyvana is a great example in early game. She wont gank you. She will get level 5 and then solo the dragon. Now everyone has a little help from her.
Shyvana will gank an overextended enemy or countergank. And a good Shyvana gets dragon at lvl 4 if the enemy team hasn't warded it and they don't have a roaming mid.

Shyvana can gank, but since she doesn't have a lot of tools to ensure a successful ganks, she relies on identifying mistakes of laners to abuse. This is why her pattern of play is turned towards farming.
If that does not happen and your jungle is clear you should start counter jungleing. Its not hard im a jungle main

Yeah, and I peaked at D3 with jungle as my primary. I've coached a lot of players, and I've written extensively on the topic.

This post is reactionary to you having a bad game in-lane. It's typical to see players behave this way when they ask for help from their jungler, and they don't get it.

Every time I see this same bitch ass post I imagine some dumb ass solo laner who went 0/4/0 before his jungler can get to level 6.  I especially love these when it turns out the enemy jungler didn't even gank either.

I'd rather have a jungle who AFK Farms than one who tries to force a gank on my lane because he feels like he has to, and ends up forcing me to flash, or worse, feeding enemy double buffs.

https://s21.postimg.org/b8pe1ay93/face_pressed_up_to_the_glass.jpg
